meanings.sent1: The phosphors on the watch glowed softly in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The TV screen uses phosphors to produce images.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous firefly mistook the phosphors on the clock for stars.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like phosphors in the night.
meanings.sent5: The glowing phosphors left a trail of light behind them.

meanings.definition: A material that emits light when struck by electrons.
meanings.sent1: The phosphors in the screen lit up when the electrons hit them.
meanings.sent2: Old TV screens used phosphors to create images.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous electron played tag with the phosphors in the tube.
meanings.sent4: His idea sparked the room like electrons hitting phosphors.
meanings.sent5: The phosphors danced with light when the electrons danced with them.
